# Commercial License

pytest-intent is available under a dual licensing model:

- **Elastic-2.0** for non-commercial use (educational institutions, government agencies, and non-profit organizations)
- **Commercial License** for for-profit entities

## Commercial License Terms

If you are a for-profit entity or using pytest-intent for commercial purposes, you are required to obtain a commercial license. The commercial license provides:

- **No copyleft obligations**: Use pytest-intent in proprietary software without the requirement to disclose your source code
- **Legal compliance**: Clear licensing terms that protect both you and the project
- **Support options**: Optional support and maintenance agreements available

## Obtaining a Commercial License

To obtain a commercial license for pytest-intent, please contact:

**Email**: chris.m.busby@gmail.com

Please include the following information in your inquiry:

- Company name and contact information
- Intended use case for pytest-intent
- Number of developers/users who will use the software
- Any specific requirements or questions

We will respond with pricing information and license terms tailored to your needs.

## License Compliance

If you are unsure whether your use case requires a commercial license, please contact us for clarification. We are happy to help you determine the appropriate licensing option for your situation.

## Educational and Government Use

Educational institutions and government agencies can use pytest-intent under the Elastic-2.0 license at no cost. This includes:

- Public and private educational institutions
- Government agencies at all levels (local, state, federal)
- Non-profit organizations
- Open source projects

If you qualify for free use under Elastic-2.0, no commercial license is required.
